alert.note: Alert for Wahkiakum (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 5:17AM PST until December 27 at 8:52PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grays River near Rosburg. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...Above 14.0 feet, expect widespread lowland flooding and numerous flooded roads near Rosburg and Hwy 4. This includes the roadway approaches to the Altoona Bridge over the Grays River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 AM PST Tuesday was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 13.2 feet late this morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 530 PM PST.
